item.title: Slot machine roguelite CloverPit tops 1 million sales
item.content:encoded:
Diego Argüello, Contributing Editor, News, GameDeveloper.com

November 13, 2025

1 Min Read

Newsbrief: CloverPit, a roguelite inspired by Balatro and Buckshot Roulette, has sold over a million copies.

Developer Panik Arcade shared the news yesterday via Steam, alongside the release of the Hard Mode Update, which adds challenges with increased difficulty, tweaks to in-game balance, and a new UI.

"We are truly in shock and deeply grateful to all of you who have supported us on this wild ride!" Panik Arcade said. Previously, the studio had accrued 500,000 sales in eight days.

CloverPit launched on September 26, preceded by a demo back in April, and it's only available on Steam.

About the Author

Contributing Editor, News, GameDeveloper.com

Diego Nicolás Argüello is a freelance journalist and critic from Argentina. Video games helped him to learn English, so now he covers them for places like The New York Times, NPR, Rolling Stone, and more. He also runs Into the Spine, a site dedicated to fostering and supporting new writers, and co-hosted Turnabout Breakdown, a podcast about the Ace Attorney series. He’s most likely playing a rhythm game as you read this.
